file_content.text: Any luck finding another transport station?
You got scans? Let's see what we can find out.
I've consulted with the team. It... does appear you found our transport system.
The aliens who built these devices believed that anyone who imprinted their genetic code on a transport site could travel there, instantly, from any other.
Of course....
Explain yourself.
That can't be for real.
Probably alien superstition, some sort of temple--there's no such thing as a "matter transmitter."
Still, it must have done something. If you can locate and operate the other stations, you could move around this prison faster than anyone.
Meanwhile, we'll be here... making sense out of it.
This whole mission may be a fool's errand, but if we can get transport working....
Captain. What's going on?
Konya Suladi, Reclamation Service special consultant. I assume you've been briefed on the vaults--the ancient technology on Belsavis?
My team translated alien writings referring to a planetary "transportation network." We've been ordered to get it up and running.
Any progress?
These references--where did you find them?
Tell me about the writings.
On the outside of the vault doors--old inscriptions, documenting the network.
You must be kidding.
I tend to agree, but a transport system that bypasses Republic defenses could win us the planet. Commander Calum is clear on that point.
Supposedly, a central transport hub is near this location, but scans don't pick up any shafts or landing pads.
The men who go searching disappear--even their locator signals go dead, like they've been disintegrated. There's something out there.
If there's another way through this prison, I want to know. I'll see what I can find.
Transport could be useful.
You'll need aid, then.
The higher-ups would agree.
Here's the area we're focused on now--you discover anything, we can swap information. But I wouldn't touch much if I were you.
Not my concern. [Refuse quest]
True enough. If we get any of this operating, someone will send word.
Take a look at files twenty-eight through forty-three... see if you can translate that.
Hardly encouraging.
